description_snippet: Contract role in the Machine Building Industry in Leicester, LE8, offering Day Shifts with an Early Finish Friday. This is an ideal role for an experienced Panel Wireman or Control Wirer who thrives in high-precision environments.

- Building and wiring control panels
- Machine wiring
- Working to wiring schematics
- Using a variety of hand tools
- Day Shifts, Early Finish Friday
Minimum Skills / Experience Required - Panel Wireman:
- Extensive experience in panel wiring or machine control wiring
- Strong understanding and experience with schematics
- Ability to use the required hand tools
- The ability to work with minimal supervision and deliver high standards
- Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
- Motivated and excellent team player
- Able to commute to the LE8 area

job_location_text: LE3 6NW (Commutable from Coventry, Hinckley, Rugby, Nuneaton and other areas close to South Leicestershire. The client is based in Leicester.)
salary_benefits: Up to
full_job_description:
Experience Required -
Production Supervisor
Fabrication shop 
Engineering Manufacturing Industry
Leicester LE3 
Up to 
Day Shifts - Early Finish Friday
Are you an experienced Supervisor, Team Leader or Workshop Manager from the Engineering Manufacturing industry? Would you like to lead and develop a motivated team within an established family-owned business?
Our client is a leading engineering manufacturer based in Leicester. They are currently looking for new Production Supervisor to run their fabrication workshop.
Commutable from Coventry, Hinckley, Rugby, Nuneaton and other areas close to South Leicestershire.
The Role - Fabrication supervisor
- To lead, motivate and manage a team of fabricators on a daily basis.
- Liaising with the office regarding bespoke requirements and sharing thoughts and experience regarding more complex specifications.
- To oversee all works being carried out in the workshop to ensure customer satisfaction at all times.
- Interpreting drawings received.
- Welding various fabricated material.
- Oversee laser cutting, shearing, folding, punching, and rubbering material using the relevant machinery.
- Arranging adequate and relevant training for new and existing staff as necessary.
- Working with other staff members effectively by coordinating workload.
- Adhering to health and safety regulations.
- All other duties as required that are considered to be a reasonable employer request.
- At least 5 years' experience in metal sheet fabrication.
- Competent with all aspect of fabrication.
- Use of CAD drawings
- Forklift licence would be preferable but not essential
- Accurate measuring ability and good numeracy skills and experience of using measuring equipment.
- The ability to understand the drawings provided.
- Relevant qualifications would be desirable.
- Previous welding/sheet metal experience essential.
- Amada machinery experience preferable.
The Package - Fabrication/shop floor supervisor 
- Starting salary up to 
- Pension
- Day Shifts - Mon to Thurs 07.30-16.30, Friday 07.30-1400
About PrecisionPeople
PrecisionPeople is a leading recruitment agency that specialises in sourcing top talent for Engineering, Technical, Sales and Senior Management roles across a wide range of industries. With a focus on precision and quality, their team of expert recruiters works tirelessly to match the best candidates with the right employers, ensuring that both parties benefit from a successful partnership.
PrecisionPeople has the expertise and resources to help you find the perfect role. With a deep understanding of the industry and a commitment to excellence, they have built a reputation for delivering exceptional results and exceeding their candidate's expectations.
Interested? To apply for this Production Supervisor position, here are your two options:
1. "This is the job for me! When can I start?" - Call (phone number removed) now and let's discuss your experience. Ask for Sharon Pickering between 0730 am - 4.30 pm
2. "I think I'm right for this position, but I'm not sure I have enough to get an interview" - Click "apply now" so I can read your CV and let you know

salary_benefits: Salary/Rate: £28,500 - £33,000/annum. Benefits: Monthly Bonus, Holiday, Pension. Specific benefits detailed: £28,500 starting salary, Monthly production bonus (~£400/month = +£5k/year) from day one, Company vehicle (after probation), 25 days holiday + bank holidays, Structured technical development in a defined engineering path, Global travel and customer exposure, A close-knit, engineering-led environment that promotes from within.
full_job_description: Graduate Engineer Engineering Degree Required Mechatronics, Mechanical or Electrical Leicester, LE19 Excellent Package and Development Opportunities Are you a bright, practically minded Mechatronics or Electrical Engineering graduate with a passion for engineering and a desire to travel the world? We’re offering an outstanding opportunity to join a fast-growing UK manufacturer of advanced CNC and EDM-based machinery used in global aerospace and industrial applications. With double-digit year-on-year growth and a strong international client base, this is your chance to get in at the ground level of a business that values initiative, technical curiosity, and career progression. The Role:You will be trained in one of the following areas: - Applications Engineering (Apps)Develop, run and fine-tune complex machine programs to match customer part specifications. Support acceptance trials, provide remote and in-person training, and travel globally to support customer implementations. Up to 40% international travel expected. - Service EngineeringInstall, commission and maintain cutting-edge precision machines at client sites around the world. Ideal for technically confident individuals eager to gain international experience and problem-solve under real-world conditions.
description_snippet: The role is for a Graduate Engineer (Mechatronics, Mechanical or Electrical degree required) to join a fast-growing UK manufacturer of advanced CNC and EDM-based machinery used in global aerospace and industrial applications. The position offers excellent development opportunities and requires a desire to travel the world. The graduate will be trained in one of two areas: Applications Engineering (Apps) or Service Engineering.
responsibilities_snippet: Key Responsibilities (depending on training path): Applications Engineering (Apps): Develop, run and fine-tune complex machine programs to match customer part specifications. Support acceptance trials, provide remote and in-person training, and travel globally to support customer implementations (Up to 40% international travel expected). Service Engineering: Install, commission and maintain cutting-edge precision machines at client sites around the world. Must-Have Skills/Requirements: A degree in Electrical, Mechatronics or Mechanical Engineering; 2:1 minimum (2:2 acceptable only if strong in all other areas); Strong practical mindset and common sense; A willingness to travel internationally; Problem-solving skills and the ability to think laterally; Excellent communication skills and professional presentation; Final-year project with a strong applied engineering focus; UK passport and driving licence (or ability to gain one quickly); A UK Passport or an EU Passport with Indefinite Leave / Right to Remain status (required due to travel requirements for certain customers locations). Nice-to-Have Skills/Requirements: Experience with CAD, CNC, robotics or control systems; Team leadership or project coordination during university.

full_job_description:
Role: Finance Manager   
 Salary: £50,000-£52,000  
 Location: Leicester  
 Are you a Finance Manager who thrives in a hands-on role? Do you enjoy rolling up your sleeves, leading from the front, and influencing decisions at the board level? If so, this opportunity could be exactly what you're looking for.  
 This is a pivotal Finance Manager position within a well-established engineering services business. The company is part of a respected international group, giving you the security of global backing with the variety of a smaller, close-knit UK team.  
 The Role   
 As Finance Manager, you'll oversee the full UK finance function, supported by a Finance Assistant. You'll be responsible for everything from balance sheets and P&L to invoicing, reconciliations, and stock management.  
 Key elements of your week will include:  
- Leading all finance operations for a £4-5m turnover business
- Monthly reporting to the Group CFO
- Partnering with senior managers to control budgets and drive cost savings
- Preparing financial analysis and business cases to support strategic decisions (including acquisitions)
- Presenting financial insights to influence board-level discussions
- Ensuring strong internal controls and compliance across finance processes
Minimum Skills / Experience Required:  
 This isn't a role for someone who wants to sit back and delegate. You'll be a hands-on Finance Manager with a proven track record of delivering results in the industry.  
 You must have:  
- Finance leadership experience within engineering, manufacturing, or service-led businesses
- CIMA qualification (part or fully qualified)
- The ability to present financial data with confidence and influence senior managers
- Solid experience in reporting, analysis, and hands-on financial management
It's a bonus if you also have:  
- Experience supporting mergers & acquisitions or preparing business cases
- Worked in an international group reporting environment
We cannot consider candidates from practice-only or public-sector backgrounds.  
 The culture  
 You'll be joining a down-to-earth, service-focused business where everyone contributes. The senior management team values commercial awareness, pragmatism, and collaboration. With just 50 employees, this is an environment where your impact will be felt daily.
description_snippet: Are you a Finance Manager who thrives in a hands-on role? Do you enjoy rolling up your sleeves, leading from the front, and influencing decisions at the board level? If so, this opportunity could be exactly what you're looking for. This is a pivotal Finance Manager position within a well-established engineering services business. The company is part of a respected international group, giving you the security of global backing with the variety of a smaller, close-knit UK team.
responsibilities_snippet:
As Finance Manager, you'll oversee the full UK finance function, supported by a Finance Assistant. You'll be responsible for everything from balance sheets and P&L to invoicing, reconciliations, and stock management. Key elements of your week will include:
- Leading all finance operations for a £4-5m turnover business
- Monthly reporting to the Group CFO
- Partnering with senior managers to control budgets and drive cost savings
- Preparing financial analysis and business cases to support strategic decisions (including acquisitions)
- Presenting financial insights to influence board-level discussions
- Ensuring strong internal controls and compliance across finance processes
Minimum Skills / Experience Required:  
 This isn't a role for someone who wants to sit back and delegate. You'll be a hands-on Finance Manager with a proven track record of delivering results in the industry.  
 You must have:  
- Finance leadership experience within engineering, manufacturing, or service-led businesses
- CIMA qualification (part or fully qualified)
- The ability to present financial data with confidence and influence senior managers
- Solid experience in reporting, analysis, and hands-on financial management
It's a bonus if you also have:  
- Experience supporting mergers & acquisitions or preparing business cases
- Worked in an international group reporting environment
We cannot consider candidates from practice-only or public-sector backgrounds.

full_job_description:
A long-established, fast-growing manufacturing business is seeking a highly motivated Production Scheduler to join its expanding operations team. You will be responsible for building and maintaining an accurate production schedule, ensuring work is released to the shop floor in line with customer requirements and agreed delivery dates.

Key Responsibilities
- Develop and maintain a detailed production schedule across all manufacturing departments, ensuring output aligns with customer commitments as a Production Scheduler
- Release jobs to production with complete and accurate information, supporting smooth workflow and minimising disruption.
- Analyse demand and capacity to optimise work centre loading, avoid bottlenecks, and maximise utilisation of machinery and labour.
- Monitor production progress in real time, proactively adjusting schedules in response to operational changes, labour availability, or equipment issues.
- Maintain full visibility and traceability of work in progress using scheduling tools and reporting systems as a Production Scheduler
- Collaborate closely with Sales, Estimating, Operations, and Procurement to ensure production plans support overall business priorities.
- Support proactive customer communication by reviewing delivery changes during office-stage processing and ensuring timely escalation where needed.
- Identify and resolve scheduling issues such as material shortages, lead-time variances, and resource conflicts.
- Track and report on key KPIs, including:
- Drive continuous improvement in planning accuracy and production efficiency through data-driven analysis.
- Work alongside Production Management and IT support to enhance ERP and planning systems.
- Take ownership of scheduling KPIs such as schedule adherence and DIFOT (Delivery in Full, On Time), analysing variances, and driving corrective actions as a Production Scheduler

Minimum Skills / Experience Required:
- Proven experience in production scheduling or planning within a manufacturing environment.
- Strong understanding of ERP systems and planning principles, with confidence in interpreting system-generated data.
- Excellent organisational and time-management abilities.
- High level of accuracy, attention to detail, and commitment to quality.
- Self-motivated, adaptable, and able to work using your own initiative.
- Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a professional and courteous manner.
- Integrity, honesty, and a positive attitude toward innovation and change.
- Ambition to build a long-term career within a growing business.

About the Company:
A well-established engineering and manufacturing business, recognised for producing high-quality sheet metal and fabricated components for a range of industries. With ongoing investment in modern machinery and a commitment to developing their people, they're now seeking an experienced Press Brake Setter Operator to join their team.
The Press Brake Setter Operator Role:
As a Press Brake Setter Operator, you'll be responsible for setting, operating, and adjusting CNC press brake machines to produce precision sheet metal parts in line with customer specifications.
Key Responsibilities:
- Set and operate CNC press brake machines (Amada, Bystronic, Trumpf, or similar).
- Read and interpret technical drawings and engineering plans.
- Carry out first-off inspections and ensure quality throughout production.
- Adjust machine settings and tooling to achieve accurate folds and dimensions.
- Maintain equipment, report faults, and ensure safe working practices.
- Work efficiently to meet production targets and deadlines.
About You
- Proven experience setting and operating CNC press brakes.
- Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings.
- Positive, proactive attitude with good communication skills.

full_job_description:
Assistant General Manager  
Leicester City Centre  
Up to £35,000 DOE  
Full-Time, Daytime Hours, Weekends Essential  
 Do you want to progress into a General Manager role within the next 6 months?  
 Our client is a Scandinavian–New York inspired brunch restaurant built on friendship, connection, and exceptional coffee. Their calm, design-led space offers a welcoming home for people who appreciate craft — from perfectly pulled espresso shots to beautifully plated brunch dishes. Due to their growth, they are expanding their leadership team and are looking for an ambitious professional to join their team. This role is ideal for a seasoned hospitality manager with strong barista skills and a passion for people.  

The role  
Assistant General Manager
- Oversee daily operations, service flow, and team performance.
- Uphold high standards of coffee, food, and atmosphere.
- Manage compliance, rotas, stock control, and reporting.
- Lead by example during busy brunch periods.
- Manage stock control, cost efficiency and supplier orders.
Senior Barista (essential)
- Lead all aspects of coffee preparation, training, and quality control.
- Support daily operations, rotas, and guest experience alongside the GM.
- Act as floor lead when the GM is away.
- Maintain EHO and hygiene compliance with precision and care.
- Maintain excellent customer service ensuring all issues are resolved
The candidate:
- Minimum 2 years’ management experience in a premium café, brunch restaurant, or boutique hospitality setting.
- Minimum 2 years’ barista experience, ideally at senior or lead level.
- Basic food hygiene or EHO knowledge desirable
- Confident in workflow management and team leadership.
- Weekend availability essential.
What is on offer:
- Competitive pay (based on experience)
- Daytime hours: typically between 08:00–19:00
- Opportunities for growth within a creative, design-led concept
- Supportive and inspiring working culture
Interested? Please click ‘Apply’ today!

The position is full-time, daytime hours, with weekends essential, and offers the opportunity to progress into a General Manager role within the next 6 months.

full_job_description:
**Welder (Structural) – Permanent Position**  
**Location:** Loughborough  
**Salary:** £18 per hour  
**Hours:** 38 hours per week (Monday to Friday, 07:30–16:30)
**About the Role**
Our client is a well-established and rapidly growing engineering company, now looking for a skilled Welder to join their expanding team. If you’re confident in your welding abilities and want to build a long-term career within a supportive and forward-thinking business, this role could be ideal for you.
**Key Responsibilities**
- Carry out high-quality MIG welding using engineering drawings and jigs
- Perform flat and vertical-up welds with precision
- Interpret engineering drawings and weld symbols accurately
- Take accurate measurements and ensure work meets specifications
- Maintain excellent safety standards and follow all company procedures
**What We’re Looking For**
- Proven experience in Overhead, Vertical-Up, and Downhand welding
- Ability to read technical drawings confidently
- Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality
- Reliable, safety-conscious attitude and good teamwork skills
**Why Join Us?**
- Competitive pay at **£18 per hour**
- Stable, full-time, permanent position
- Opportunities to progress within a growing company
- Supportive team with a positive working environment
- Access to modern tools, equipment, and facilities

Benefits: Profit Share Scheme, Multi Skilled Bonus (£1/hr extra), Overtime Pay Premiums, 30 Days Holiday (Including Bank Holidays), Enhanced Sick Pay and Healthcare Plan, Group Life Cover, Clear Career Progression Path, Training and Upskilling Opportunities, Internal Promotion Opportunities and Cycle to Work Scheme.
full_job_description: If you’ve got MIG welding experience and want to join a company that actually invests in your skills, this is the one. You’ll be working on high quality sheet metal projects for major customers, using modern equipment in a clean, organised workshop where precision and pride really matter. This is a busy, long established manufacturer in Loughborough with around 100 staff and a full order book stretching well into next year. They’re known locally for looking after their people, promoting from within and offering genuine training opportunities to help you progress in your career. Pay: £14.00 - £15.50 per hour (based on experience, reviewed after probation) Benefits: Profit Share Scheme, Multi Skilled Bonus (£1/hr extra), Overtime Pay Premiums, 30 Days Holiday (Including Bank Holidays), Enhanced Sick Pay and Healthcare Plan, Group Life Cover, Clear Career Progression Path, Training and Upskilling Opportunities, Internal Promotion Opportunities and Cycle to Work Scheme. Your Responsibilities: Carry out MIG welding on sheet metal components, ensuring strong and accurate welds. Set up and adjust welding equipment for various materials and specifications. Read and interpret engineering drawings to achieve precise, consistent results. Perform quality checks using measuring tools to verify weld integrity. Support grinding and finishing of welded components as required. What We’re Looking For: Proven experience in MIG welding within a manufacturing or fabrication environment. Ability to interpret drawings and produce accurate, high quality welds. Competence with grinders, finishing tools and fabrication equipment. A good eye for detail and pride in producing clean, professional work. Reliable, adaptable and confident working both independently and as part of a team. Recruitment Process: To apply, simply upload your CV below or contact Josh Whitmore on (phone number removed) or (url removed) Successful candidates will then be invited to an onsite interview and MIG welding skills test with the Team Leader. Ready to take your welding career further with a company that values your craft? *Your Recruiters Ltd is an equal opportunity employer, celebrating diversity and inclusion at every level. All applications receive a personal response, with detailed feedback for anyone interviewed but unsuccessful.

A supportive environment with autonomy, variety, and career growth potential. Work within a forward-thinking, employee-driven business investing in technology and people.
full_job_description:
A growing engineering business specialising in the design and manufacture of bespoke automation and mechanical systems is seeking an experienced Engineering Project Manager to join its expanding team. The company operates across regulated and industrial sectors, delivering complex, high-precision systems that meet demanding technical and regulatory standards.
As a well-established and employee-focused organisation, the business continues to invest in innovation and people, with a strong pipeline of new projects and long-term customer partnerships.
**The Role** 
 As Engineering Project Manager, you’ll take ownership of multiple projects from initial concept through to final delivery. You will oversee planning, coordination, and execution across mechanical, electrical, software, and build disciplines—ensuring projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.
This is a hands-on, delivery-focused position that requires both technical understanding and strong commercial acumen. You’ll work closely with customers, engineering teams, and senior stakeholders to drive accountability and successful outcomes across the full project lifecycle.
**Key Responsibilities**
- Lead and manage several concurrent engineering projects (typically 3–4 at a time) from concept through to completion.
- Ensure all projects meet contractual and commercial milestones, including agreed payment stages.
- Take ownership of project budgets, costings, and margins.
- Plan and allocate resources effectively across design, build, and commissioning teams.
- Lead structured design reviews and ensure adherence to engineering standards and compliance requirements.
- Act as the main customer contact throughout the project, managing scope changes, risks, and technical queries.
- Ensure projects meet internal quality, documentation, and handover standards.
- Drive continuous improvement across processes, design delivery, and communication.
**About You** 
 We’re looking for an experienced and proactive Project Manager with a strong background in automation, machinery, or special-purpose equipment design. You’ll be commercially aware, technically capable, and confident managing cross-functional teams and customers in a dynamic environment.
**Key Skills & Experience**
- Degree-qualified in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline.
- Minimum 10 years’ experience managing engineering or automation projects.
- Strong technical understanding of automated systems, robotics, or machinery.
- Proven experience in regulated or high-precision industries (medical, healthcare, packaging, etc.).
- Confident managing budgets, timelines, and multi-disciplinary engineering teams.
- Skilled communicator with the ability to manage stakeholders at all levels.
- Proficient in Microsoft Project or similar project management tools.
**Personal Attributes**
- Hands-on and delivery-focused with a strong sense of ownership.
- Collaborative, calm under pressure, and customer-oriented.
- Able to balance technical, commercial, and operational priorities effectively.
- Willingness to travel occasionally within the UK and overseas.
**What’s on Offer**
- Competitive salary and benefits package.
- Opportunity to lead innovative engineering projects with real impact.
- A supportive environment with autonomy, variety, and career growth potential.
- Work within a forward-thinking, employee-driven business investing in technology and people.
If this role would be of interest to you, please click apply today.

The company operates across regulated and industrial sectors, delivering complex, high-precision systems that meet demanding technical and regulatory standards. As Engineering Project Manager, you’ll take ownership of multiple projects from initial concept through to final delivery. You will oversee planning, coordination, and execution across mechanical, electrical, software, and build disciplines—ensuring projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. This is a hands-on, delivery-focused position that requires both technical understanding and strong commercial acumen.

salary_benefits: £28,683/annum (£28,683.20 per annum). Benefits include: competitive Pension Scheme, Life Insurance, Cycle2Work scheme, Employee Assistance Program.
full_job_description:
Ready for a career move where you can make a real impact? Join **the client**, one of the UK's top distribution brands, as a Warehouse Team Leader and play a vital role in driving success. We're looking for a dedicated leader who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and is passionate about helping the team shine.  
As a Warehouse Team Leader, you'll be at the heart of the action, ensuring parcels are handled with precision, operational targets are met, and safety and quality standards are top-notch. You'll lead a fantastic team, inspiring them to deliver excellence every day while driving performance and fostering a positive, results-driven culture.  
But it's not just about what you'll do — it's about where you'll do it. With a commitment to personal growth and career development, **the client** is the place where you can take your career to new heights. Whether you're looking to develop your leadership skills, grow in logistics, or make an impact in a world-class organization, this is the opportunity for you!  
- Lead and inspire a motivated team, ensuring smooth and efficient parcel handling, sorting, and scanning.
- Drive the performance of the warehouse by managing the throughput of parcels to meet and exceed operational targets.
- Perform quality checks to guarantee all parcels meet company standards, keeping safety at the forefront.
- Train and develop new team members, helping them excel and maintain top-tier performance.
- Support the shift manager by addressing any challenges and ensuring the day-to-day operations run smoothly.
- Foster a clean, safe, and organized warehouse environment, championing both company policies and health & safety standards.
- A passionate, proactive leader with experience in warehouse management or a similar role.
- Excellent communication skills, with the ability to motivate and guide a team.
- Flexibility and adaptability in a high-energy environment.
- Physically fit and ready to meet the demands of the warehouse.
- A commitment to upholding safety and operational excellence.
- **Right to Work in the UK**: You must have the legal right to work in the UK.
We love to reward our people for the great work they do:  
- Build a secure future with a competitive Pension Scheme
- Peace of mind with Life Insurance
- Stay active with our Cycle2Work scheme
- Get the support you need with our Employee Assistance Program

full_job_description:
Job Title: Toolroom Manager
Location: Leicestershire
Shift: Monday - Thursday, 8am - 5pm and Friday, 8am - 4pm
Pay: Up to £50,000 per annum
Benefits:
- Permanent position
- Free onsite parking
- Company events
- Company pension
- Overtime available
The Company
A well-established manufacturer of high-precision plastic injection moulds, supplying a range of key industries across the UK and Europe.
The Toolroom Manager Role:
We are currently seeking a driven and committed Toolroom Manager to join our growing team. This position has become available due to continued business growth, with projected expansion of over 50% in the next year. We're looking for motivated individuals to help us meet this demand.
We take pride in maintaining a clean, organised, and professional toolroom. The successful candidate will play a key role in sustaining and improving standards of organisation, cleanliness, and overall presentation.
- Liaise with the customer to understand their needs within a project and communicate this clearly to the design and manufacturing team.
- Tool design, Mould flow and DFM interrogation to check feasibility and suitability of the design against the customers and moulders needs.
- Understand and interrogate part and tool designs for manufacturability and efficiency
- Assign daily workload to the shopfloor staff and explain each job to them as required
- Troubleshoot manufacturing issues from CNC machining, EDM machining and fitting issues.
- Monitor progress and provide regular updates to customers
- Create project plans showing the timeline of key activities in the project
- Attend the final tool build checklist with the fitting team, making sure the quality standards are met before we despatch tooling to customers
- Buying of mould bases, standard mould parts, cutting tools and other workshop equipment.
- Project management of Chinese tooling, communicating with our project managers oversees to check progress and quality. International travel could be available but not essential.
- Attend tool trials and provide support to the process team for troubleshooting
- Review parts from trials and understand injection moulding process/tooling defects
- Create tooling rework plans and oversee trial loop until approved
About You:
- Strong technical background in plastics and tooling
- Experience in interpreting 2D and 3D engineering drawings
- Background in tool design, mould flow analysis, and DFM reviews
- Involvement in managing varied tooling projects from start to finish
- Hands-on experience with CNC machining, EDM, and tool fitting processes
- Proven people management and organisational skills
- Excellent attention to detail and quality standards
- Flexibility to adapt to different projects and changing priorities
- Strong communication skills to liaise with customers and internal teams
- Ability to create and manage project timelines and tooling plans
How to Apply:
To apply for the Toolroom Manager position, click Apply Now and upload your CV. A member of our recruitment team will contact you to discuss your application and next steps.

salary_benefits:
Salary: £27,000 - £32,000 per annum (DOE).
Benefits: Quarterly bonus scheme (non-contractual), Life assurance, Enhanced holiday entitlement with service-linked increases, Pension scheme, Company-provided workwear and PPE, On-site gym, canteen, and parking, Employee Assistance Programme, Continuous training and career development opportunities.
full_job_description:
Job Opportunity: CAD/CAM Engineer (Sheet Metal Manufacturing)
Location: Leicester, East Midlands
Salary: £27,000 - £32,000 per annum (DOE)
Hours: Monday - Thursday, 07:30 - 16:00 (40 hours per week), Friday 12:30 Finish
Type: Permanent, Full-Time
Start Date: Immediate

About the Company
Our client is a leading UK metal manufacturing specialist, they partner with major national brands across industries such as rail, transport, retail, and construction.
A family-run business, they pride themselves on their commitment to quality, investment in cutting-edge technology, and dedication to developing their people. With over 100 skilled employees, the company continues to grow year-on-year thanks to its focus on innovation, craftsmanship, and exceptional customer service.

The Role: CAD/CAM Engineer
As a CAD/CAM Engineer, you will play a crucial role in producing high-quality and dimensionally accurate engineering drawings and CNC programs for the manufacturing of sheet metal components. You will work closely with production and clients to ensure orders meet technical specifications, efficiency standards, and quality expectations.

Key Responsibilities
- Create accurate 2D CAD/CAM profiles in line with client specifications.
- Develop CNC programs that maximise efficiency in material use and machine time.
- Produce detailed manufacturing drawings for press, fabrication, and assembly operations.
- Update and modify CAD/CNC data as required.
- Maintain organised drawing and program records.
- Communicate clearly with clients regarding order details and requirements.
- Prepare Bill of Materials (BOM) lists for the purchasing team to ensure all project materials are available.

Skills & Experience
Essential:
- Proficiency in 2D CAD software (AutoCAD or TruTops preferred).
- Strong SolidWorks experience (sheet metal design essential).
- Solid understanding of sheet metal manufacturing processes.
- Confident user of MS Office / Office 365, particularly Excel and Teams.
Desirable:
- Experience with Trumpf CAM software (advantageous but not essential).

Personal Attributes
- Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in work.
- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Professional, approachable, and adaptable attitude.
- Focused and reliable under pressure.
- Innovative problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
- Enthusiastic about developing a long-term career in manufacturing.

Benefits
- Salary: £27,000 - £32,000 per annum (DOE).
- Quarterly bonus scheme (non-contractual).
- Life assurance.
- Enhanced holiday entitlement with service-linked increases.
- Pension scheme.
- Company-provided workwear and PPE.
- On-site gym, canteen, and parking.
- Employee Assistance Programme.
- Continuous training and career development opportunities.

About Regional Recruitment Services
This role is advertised by Regional Recruitment Services Ltd, an award-winning independent recruitment agency established in 2008. We specialise in connecting skilled professionals to opportunities across the Engineering, Industrial, and Technical sectors.
Contact Us: (phone number removed)
Visit: (url removed)
If you are passionate about precision engineering and want to progress your career with a respected and growing manufacturer, apply today or call our Industrial team for more details.

This is a Permanent, Full-Time position with hours Monday - Thursday, 07:30 - 16:00 (40 hours per week), and a Friday 12:30 Finish. The role is with a leading UK metal manufacturing specialist in Leicester, East Midlands.
